summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York and defense attorneys from Winston & Strawn LLP regarding a grand jury subpoena issued to a client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell). The emails discuss scheduling meetings, sharing case materials, and negotiating the postponement of a grand jury appearance. A key revelation is the mention of cell phone records registered to the client showing contacts with multiple underage girls.

persons.name: Hudgens, Johanna Rae
persons.context: An associate attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP corresponding with federal prosecutors to schedule meetings and confirm details regarding a grand jury subpoena issued to their client.

persons.name: Bloom, Suzanne Jaffe
persons.context: A partner at Winston & Strawn LLP representing a client who received a grand jury subpoena; she is the primary point of contact negotiating with federal prosecutors.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: An unnamed prosecutor from the Southern District of New York leading communications with defense counsel regarding the grand jury subpoena and investigation.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on the defense of a client subpoenaed by a grand jury.
Defense attorney and federal prosecutor negotiating terms related to a grand jury subpoena and potential client interview.
Associate defense attorney coordinating logistics with the federal prosecution team.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to an individual (client of Winston & Strawn).

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The initial date the subpoenaed individual was to appear before the grand jury; this date was adjourned.

events.title: Proposed Meeting Date
events.description: A meeting is scheduled between federal prosecutors and defense attorneys to discuss the case.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Winston & Strawn LLP, 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors informed defense counsel that they possess cell phone records registered in the client's name showing 'numerous phone contacts with multiple girls who were underage at the time of the calls.'
The prosecution and defense were negotiating a potential voluntary interview with the client in lieu of an immediate grand jury appearance.
The prosecution provided defense counsel with docket numbers for related civil cases and an example of a standard proffer agreement.
The client's identity is heavily implied but redacted in the correspondence; the context suggests it is Ghislaine Maxwell.
The correspondence shows a cooperative but adversarial pre-indictment phase between the SDNY and Maxwell's legal team.
